chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle K. Goldberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kyle K. Goldberg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kyle K. Goldberg was found guilty of Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription - to be approved by agent.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Perform  100    hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Not to live in home w/ alcohol or drugs in it.

timeConds.notes: Stayed - for agent to determine if Living Free is necessary.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

records.addlTxt: Discharged from probation on 3/25/17
Discharged 3/25/17
Refund DOC overpayment back to DOC;  ck#15CH074894
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; 6 months conditional jail is stayed; deft to do 100 hrs of community service; credit for 2 days served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs.
from Chris Butler to Atty Watson
With Atty Watson the SEH of 3/6/15 at 9am is rescheduled, as the deft will be in treatment until  March 11; reset to 3/25/15 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty K Watson appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court notes that the deft checked himself into treatment.  SEH adjourned to 3/6/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 2/12/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA C McNeill

Judge Wilbur W Warren III, Acting Br. 6 today only.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty K Watson appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft's appearance is excused.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 11/17/14 at 1:15pm and JS 12/8/14 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Pretrial adj. to 8/25/14 at 8:15, to allow Atty Watson time to discuss plea options with defendant.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on August 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.
with Atty Watson the FPT of 7/18/14 at 8:45am is rescheduled, due to a conflict w/the Court's calendar; reset to 8/6/14 at 9am.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states she needs time to discuss case w/deft.  FPT continued to 7/18/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
from Angela Becerra @ Gateway to Defendnat

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Rufo, for Atty K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rufo states she believes there are negotiations ongoing.  FPT continued to 6/25/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 5/13/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 3/21/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 4/3/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
